data.scheme_name: New Industrial Policy 2020-25 - Investment Promotion Subsidy for Medium Enterprises - Existing
data.benefits: Scheme provides Investment Promotion Subsidy upto 40% on Value of fixed assets (VFA) for a maximum period 6 years to attract investment and generate employment.
data.eligibility: Units engaged in Manufacturing and Manufacturing-related service industries are eligible under the scheme.
data.conditions: Minimum direct Employment 20 Number for first Rs 1000 lakhs and additional 7 employment for every additional investment of Rs 1000 lakhs proportionately.
data.beneficiaries: Units engaged in Manufacturing and Manufacturing-related service industries are eligible under the scheme.
data.prerequisites: Minimum direct Employment 20 Number for first Rs 1000 lakhs and additional 7 employment for every additional investment of Rs 1000 lakhs proportionately. Eligible MSMEs shall commence commercial production within 3 years from the date of approval from the DLSWCC / SLSWCC. If any enterprise who has not taken approval from the DLSWCC / SLSWCC for their project for any reason shall commence commercial production within 3 years from the date of taking possession of land / building or taking building plan approval. Eligible MSMEs shall submit application for sanction of Investment Promotion subsidy within one year from the date of commencement of commercial production.
data.nodal_agency: State Level Co-ordination Committee (SLCC), Government of Karnataka
data.context: Government is pleased to announce the New Industrial Policy 2020-25, to build on the strengths of Karnataka industry and to enable it to fulfill its role as the engine of growth and to shoulder responsibility of adding more hi-tech value and employment. The new industrial revolution presents new opportunities for industry, particularly manufacturing and manufacturing-related service industries. These developments are enabling smart manufacturing, customization, collaborative production and other new production modes and business models.
data.objective: The aim is to attract INR 5 Lakh crore in investments, create 20 lakh jobs, achieve 3rd position in merchandise exports, maintain a 10% industrial growth rate, and foster an ecosystem for technology adoption and innovation.
data.description:
Investment Promotion Subsidy-
Zone 1- 2.5% of turnover or maximum of 40% of Value of fixed assets (VFA) for a maximum period 6 years
Zone 2- 2.5% of turnover or maximum of 35% of Value of fixed assets (VFA) for a maximum period 5 years
Zone 3- No Benefit for this Zone
data.how_to_apply: Applicant can register themselves on EBIZ- https://ebiz.karnataka.gov.in/kum/InvestorRegistrationForm.aspx
data.funding_facilitator: Commerce and Industries Department, Government of Karnataka
data.funding_mechanism: Amount will be disbursed to the beneficiary after approval of the application by the concerned authority.

Zone 2: Magadi, Ramanagara, Channapatna, Kanakapura, Harohalli, Hiriyur, Chitradurga, Challakere, Hosadurga, Molkalmuru, Davanagere, Harihar, Nyamati, Chintamani, Gowribidanur, Siddlaghatta, Cheluru, Bangarpet, KGF, Kolar, Malur, Mulbagal, Sagar, ThirthahaIli, Shivamogga, Bhadravathi, Turuvekere, Sira, Tiptur, Kunigal, Tumakur, Kadur, Mudigere, Tarikere, Chikkamagaluru, Ajjampur, Shringeri, Koppa, N R Pura, Kalasa, Bantwal, Sulya, Belthangadi, Puttur, Mulki, Ullal, Moodbidri, Kadaba, Mangalore, Alur, C R Patna, Shantigrama, Hassan, H N Pura, Sakleshpura, Srirangapatna, Pandavapura, Mandya, Maddur, Nagamangala, Malavalli, K R Pet, Hunsur, K R Nagara, Mysuru, Nanjangud, T N Pura, Periyapatna, H D Kote, Saraguru, Saligrama, Karkala, Bhramhavara, Udupi, Kundapura, Kapu, Hebri, Baindur.
  3. Zone 3: Anekal, Bengaluru (N), Bengaluru (S), Yelahanka, Bengaluru (E), Devanahalli, Doddaballapura, Hoskote, Nelamangala
    4. The Investment Promotion Subsidy is based on a percentage of turnover, depending on location and investments, for a specified period or fixed asset value. Eligible enterprises must register separately under GST for manufacturing eligible products, and only this turnover will be considered for the subsidy. Trading or non-eligible services at the same business location will disqualify the enterprise from the subsidy. The resale of products is not eligible for turnover incentives. If the enterprise is already manufacturing the same product in existing units, the turnover for five consecutive years must not be lower than the average of the previous three years. Only new investments qualify for the incentive.
data.checklist_info_a:
1. Common Application Form* 
2. Land/building-rent/lease agreement (If unit is rented /leased) 
3. Partnership deed / Articles of Association/byelaws 
4. Self-attested Project Report 
5. District Level Single Window Clearance Committee (DLSWCC) / State Level Single Window Clearance Committee (SLSWCC) approval order 
6. Udyam Registration Certificate /Industrial Entrepreneur Memorandum (IEM)/Industrial License (IL)  
7. Caste certificate 
8. Ex-service men certificate, if applicable 
9. Other Basic KYC Documents
